meanings.sent1: The magician's juggleries amazed the audience with their illusions.
meanings.sent2: She saw through his juggleries and knew he was not being honest.
meanings.sent3: The salesman's juggleries with the numbers made the customer suspicious.
meanings.sent4: His political campaign was full of juggleries to sway public opinion.
meanings.sent5: The juggleries of the con artist fooled many unsuspecting victims.

meanings.definition: Acts of juggling or performing tricks with objects
meanings.sent1: The circus performer's juggleries with balls were mesmerizing.
meanings.sent2: Children love watching street performers' juggleries with colorful scarves.
meanings.sent3: The clown's juggleries with rubber chickens always made the kids laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her impressive juggleries with flaming torches left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent5: The juggleries of the acrobat were the highlight of the show.

meanings.sent1: The spy's juggleries in gathering information were unmatched.
meanings.sent2: The CEO's financial juggleries led to the company's downfall.
meanings.sent3: The politician's juggleries with promises left many disappointed.
meanings.sent4: Her juggleries in negotiations always got her what she wanted.
meanings.sent5: The mastermind's juggleries in the heist were carefully planned.
